page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The D block studied by Crieff High School lies half a kilometre East of Crieff in the heart of Perthshire. Our area consisted mostly of forestry and farmland. It covered a large section of the{Abercairney {Estate}owned by the{Drummond Murray family. The project reflected this in its contents. Much of the work was connected with the estate, past and present. It tried to convey what it means to live and work in such a rural area by interviewing a number of estate employees and their families. We also looked at special features of our area eg.{Highlandman Loan, Pow {Burn}and{Inchbrakie Castle,}as well as national issues eg. employment, housing, transport and social services. _
